reference.shortdesc: The elementdef element identifies an element to which an attribute is bound. If the enumerationdef element does not contain an elementdef element, the enumeration is bound to the attribute in all elements.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The elementdef element is specialized from . It is defined in the topic module.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: , status and base from , , , and the attributes defined below.

dlentry.dd: Defines the element for which an attribute enumeration is defined.

example.title: Example
example.p: In this example, the value attribute for the lomDifficulty element is bound to a specified set of values. Processors should limit the values for the value attribute on the lomDifficulty element to the following set of values: easy, medium, or difficult. Other elements that have a value attribute are not affected.
example.codeblock: <subjectScheme> <subjectdef keys="difficulty"> <subjectdef keys="easy"/> <subjectdef keys="medium"/> <subjectdef keys="difficult"/> </subjectdef> <!-- ... --> <enumerationdef> <elementdef name="lomDifficulty"/> <attributedef name="value"/> <subjectdef keyref="difficulty"/> </enumerationdef> </subjectScheme>
